title: Unnamed Keen mod
content:
Hey there,

I just felt like putting a screenshot online of a mod I've been working on.
It's just another of Keen's adventures, somewhere before the original trilogy, but it has no real story yet.
What I do have is a new (partial) tileset (still under construction) and some general level ideas, which I should be able to flesh out relatively quick.
(The screenshot is just a mockup, one of many to test how my tiles interact.)
I also plan on changing the default enemies a bit, but I have no idea how just yet.
I'll visit the modding forum once I feel it's their turn.

I started maybe 6 months ago, but I've paused for too long numerous times, or it would've been done in 3 months or less, I'd guess.

[img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Color_1.png[/img] [img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Color_2.png[/img]

Edit: I added a 2nd screenshot showing some more tiles, again just a "level" I threw together.

05-06-2006 edit: Fixed graphics, which seems to have bumped this thread, which is exactly what I hoped it would not do. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

Anyway, I'm planning on continuing with this mod.
I pretty much stopped right after posting this original post, so there's still a bunch of things to be done.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten.

title: Re: Unnamed Keen mod
content:
Nice looking! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] I'll look forward to hearing more on this. Also, remember that you should keep modding talk to [url=http://andy.durdin.net/keen/modding]Keen:Modding[/url] unless you have finished and released the mod.

Go to [url=http://www.toxicsheep.com]www.toxicsheep.com[/url] to see my site!

title: Re: Depthful.
content:
Thanks for the kind words everybody. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
I added another screenshot of a fake level to show some more tiles.

The lava ones I've been working on more recently, and I think they're OK.
I still need a bunch of blue metal tiles though, I don't have near enough to build anything that doesn't look way too repetetive.
Like Spleen noticed, I'm trying to make tiles re-usable in (slightly) different places, if possible in other "sets" to get as much as possible out of a limited amount of tiles.

I'll be sure to head over to the modding forum once I'll get to the more difficult aspects of modding, like masking the tiles, reworking enemies, whatever gives me trouble. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
Good thing the Keen community is a nice one in helping eachother out.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten.

title: Theming!
content:
My God... that's some insane stuff right there. You certainly have a knack for theming. Most of my tile themes are randomly thrown together based on colour combinations, mostly, but in your screenshots everything looks like it belongs where it is (especially that tasty looking beverage item for the lava tileset).

One minor suggestion: you might want to add some of those bumps to the left-edge wall tile so it blends in better. It might get repetitive like that, though, but it's worth trying.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

"You are so afraid to live--so afraid of life itself--that you've given up the very nature of your being in trade for security."
-CWG Book 3, Neale Donald Walsh

title: Re: *mind boggle*
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]One minor suggestion: you might want to add some of those bumps to the left-edge wall tile so it blends in better. It might get repetitive like that, though, but it's worth trying.[hr][/quote]

You're right, that did improve the overall look.
Thanks for the tip. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Thanks everybody else for the positive comments too.

As for more screenies, first of all, like I previously mentioned, I'm not exactly hurrying this, although since I recently picked it up again I made some good progress.
However, in my opinion part of what makes games like these more fun is the exploring aspect, so I'd rather not want to spoil too much.
There are only so many different tiles I can paint and show, and once I get to working on some actual levels, I'd rather release an in-progress mod with just a couple of levels instead.
That way I can get some critiques on gameplay as well.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten.

title: Re: *mind boggle*
content:
About the 15-06 edit... well, that's a typo. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
I corrected it, but by now the date is 666, so it's still incorrect.

This whole thread never was supposed to be bumped in the first place.
I figured a simple edit wouldn't mark it as having an update.
Of course someone voting in a(n ancient) poll also marks it as being updated, so I should've known.

Anyway, after a little help in the K:M forum I am now confident enough to reorder the tileset, and finally start working on this thing again. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
It seems there are still a bunch of tiles I can use/repaint, but I'll re"program" my existing tiles so I can properly test my levels, and get the basic level structures up.Retodon8
